metadata.title: W3Schools.com
metadata.Keywords: HTML, Python, CSS, SQL, JavaScript, How to, PHP, Java, C, C++, C#, jQuery, Bootstrap, Colors, W3.CSS, XML, MySQL, Icons, NodeJS, React, Graphics, Angular, R, AI, Git, Data Science, Code Game, Tutorials, Programming, Web Development, Training, Learning, Quiz, Exercises, Courses, Lessons, References, Examples, Learn to code, Source code, Demos, Tips, Website
metadata.Description: Well organized and easy to understand Web building tutorials with lots of examples of how to use HTML, CSS, JavaScript, SQL, Python, PHP, Bootstrap, Java, XML and more.
metadata.og:description: W3Schools offers free online tutorials, references and exercises in all the major languages of the web. Covering popular subjects like HTML, CSS, JavaScript, Python, SQL, Java, and many, many more.
metadata.keywords: HTML, Python, CSS, SQL, JavaScript, How to, PHP, Java, C, C++, C#, jQuery, Bootstrap, Colors, W3.CSS, XML, MySQL, Icons, NodeJS, React, Graphics, Angular, R, AI, Git, Data Science, Code Game, Tutorials, Programming, Web Development, Training, Learning, Quiz, Exercises, Courses, Lessons, References, Examples, Learn to code, Source code, Demos, Tips, Website

content.text: AppML Architecture
Modern Web Architecture
AppML combines the most up-to-date techniques and ideas of modern web development.
content.html: AppML combines the most up-to-date techniques and ideas of modern web development.

content.text: AppML focus on speed, simplicity, and low cost:
content.html: AppML focus on speed, simplicity, and low cost:

content.text: MVC Architecture
AppML uses an MVC Architecture
content.html: AppML uses an MVC Architecture

content.text: MVC stands for Model, View, Controller
content.html: MVC stands for Model, View, Controller

content.text: The Model describes your application.
content.html: The Model describes your application.

content.text: The View displays your data.
content.html: The View displays your data.

content.text: The Controller controls your application (of course).
content.html: The Controller controls your application (of course).

content.text: Wikipedia: Model, View, Controller
content.html: Wikipedia: Model, View, Controller

content.text: The MODEL - Just JSON
The model describes the application.
content.html: The model describes the application.

content.text: The model is reusable on different hardware and software platforms (Server, PC, iPhone, Tablets, etc.).
content.html: The model is reusable on different hardware and software platforms (Server, PC, iPhone, Tablets, etc.).

content.text: The model is not concerned with presentation or user interface (UI).
content.html: The model is not concerned with presentation or user interface (UI).

content.text: The model is written in JSON:
content.html: The model is written in JSON:

content.code_html:
{
"rowsperpage" : 10,
"database" : {
    "connection" : "localmysql",
    "sql" : "SELECT CustomerName, City, Country FROM Customers",
    "orderby" : "CustomerName"
},
"filteritems" : [
    {"item" : "CustomerName", "label" : "Customer"},
    {"item" : "City"},
    {"item" : "Country"}
],
"sortitems" : [
    {"item" : "CustomerName", "label" : "Customer"},
    {"item" : "City"},
    {"item" : "Country"}
]
}

content.text: The VIEW - Just HTML
The view is the UI (User Interface) for displaying (and input) data.
content.html: The view is the UI (User Interface) for displaying (and input) data.

content.text: The view is written in HTML and CSS:
content.html: The view is written in HTML and CSS:

content.code:
Customers

Customer City Country
{{CustomerName}} {{City}} {{Country}}
content.code_html:
<!DOCTYPE html>
<html lang="en-US">
<title>Customers</title>
<link rel="stylesheet" href="https://www.w3schools.com/w3css/4/w3.css">
<script src="https://www.w3schools.com/appml/2.0.3/appml.js"></script>
<body>

<div class="w3-container" appml-data="local?model=model_customers">
<h1>Customers</h1>
<div appml-include-html="inc_listcommands.htm"></div>
<div appml-include-html="inc_filter.htm"></div>
<table class="w3-table-all">
  <tr>
    <th>Customer</th>
    <th>City</th>
    <th>Country</th>
  </tr>
  <tr appml-repeat="records">
    <td>{{CustomerName}}</td>
    <td>{{City}}</td>
    <td>{{Country}}</td>
</tr>
</table>
</div>

</body>
</html>

content.text: The CONTROLLER - Client and/or Server Scripts
A client script in the web page can control the application:
content.html: A client script in the web page can control the application:

content.text: A server script can control the application by:
content.html: A server script can control the application by:

content.text: The Art of Programming
Keeping application size and complexity low, is the main problem of all programming.
content.html: Keeping application size and complexity low, is the main problem of all programming.

content.text: Controlling computer application complexity, is the true art of programming.
content.html: Controlling computer application complexity, is the true art of programming.

content.text: Declarative Programming
Software development often breaks deadlines and budgets. Finished software is often full of coding errors. This is because computer code is difficult to develop, test, and maintain.
content.html: Software development often breaks deadlines and budgets. Finished software is often full of coding errors. This is because computer code is difficult to develop, test, and maintain.

content.text: Coding is Out . You should describe more What to do, less How to do it.
content.html: Coding is Out. You should describe more What to do, less How to do it.

content.text: With AppML you Declare your application in the Model and in the View .
content.html: With AppML you Declare your application in the Model and in the View.

content.text: With AppML there is less (sometimes nothing) to code .
content.html: With AppML there is less (sometimes nothing) to code.

content.text: Wikipedia: Declarative Programming
content.html: Wikipedia: Declarative Programming

content.text: Rapid and Agile Application Development
Controlling computer application complexity is the true art of programming.
content.html: Controlling computer application complexity is the true art of programming.

content.text: Keeping application size and complexity under under control is the main problem of all programming.
content.html: Keeping application size and complexity under under control is the main problem of all programming.

content.text: RAD is a software development method that uses minimal planning in favor of rapid prototyping.
content.html: RAD is a software development method that uses minimal planning in favor of rapid prototyping.

content.text: AppML delivers super-fast prototyping, up to 100 times faster than traditional development methods.
content.html: AppML delivers super-fast prototyping, up to 100 times faster than traditional development methods.

content.text: Application prototypes can run directly from the application model, without any coding.
content.html: Application prototypes can run directly from the application model, without any coding.

content.text: Wikipedia: Rapid Application Development
content.html: Wikipedia: Rapid Application Development

content.text: Agile software development is a method based on step-by-step development, where solutions are created by users and developers in collaboration.
content.html: Agile software development is a method based on step-by-step development, where solutions are created by users and developers in collaboration.

content.text: With AppML, applications can be written step by step, in small increments, from prototypes to full applications.
content.html: With AppML, applications can be written step by step, in small increments, from prototypes to full applications.

content.text: Wikipedia: Agile Software Development
content.html: Wikipedia: Agile Software Development

content.text: Code First
A web application can be developed in two different ways:
content.html: A web application can be developed in two different ways:

content.text: 1. Code First: Using pre-programmed, pre-tested code, adding only new application descriptions.
content.html: 1. Code First: Using pre-programmed, pre-tested code, adding only new application descriptions.

content.text: 2. Contract First: Coding the application from scratch using the full application requirement description.
content.html: 2. Contract First: Coding the application from scratch using the full application requirement description.

content.text: AppML uses the most rational concept: Code First .
content.html: AppML uses the most rational concept: Code First.

content.text: Service Oriented Architecture (SOA)
Service Oriented Architecture (SOA) is an architecture for building web applications.
content.html: Service Oriented Architecture (SOA) is an architecture for building web applications.

content.text: SOA offers low development costs and high flexibility.
content.html: SOA offers low development costs and high flexibility.

content.text: With SOA , applications can be created from scratch, or from existing IT infrastructures, and be used, by different applications, on different hardware and software.
content.html: With SOA, applications can be created from scratch, or from existing IT infrastructures, and be used, by different applications, on different hardware and software.

content.text: SOA is a perfect fit for MVC and Declarative Programming , where data can be easily consumed without the concern about how.
content.html: SOA is a perfect fit for MVC and Declarative Programming, where data can be easily consumed without the concern about how.

content.text: Web Services
A Web Service is an interface to data, identified by a URL, just like a web page.
content.html: A Web Service is an interface to data, identified by a URL, just like a web page.

content.text: A Web Service differs from a web page, only in the way it communicates information.
content.html: A Web Service differs from a web page, only in the way it communicates information.

content.text: A typical Web Service only provides data to a web page.
content.html: A typical Web Service only provides data to a web page.

content.text: With AppML, HTML is the user interface, a Web Service provides the data.
content.html: With AppML, HTML is the user interface, a Web Service provides the data.

content.text: Original Web Services were designed to use XML standards like SOAP, WSDL, and UDDI.
content.html: Original Web Services were designed to use XML standards like SOAP, WSDL, and UDDI.

content.text: Modern Web Services like AppML are much easier to use.
content.html: Modern Web Services like AppML are much easier to use.

content.text: Benefits of Web Services
Example: A small program designed to supply other applications with the stock exchange prices.
content.html: Example: A small program designed to supply other applications with the stock exchange prices.

content.text: Example: Flight schedules and ticket reservation systems.
content.html: Example: Flight schedules and ticket reservation systems.

content.text: Since web services use HTTP, they are independent of both operating systems and programming languages.
content.html: Since web services use HTTP, they are independent of both operating systems and programming languages.

content.text: Cloud Computing
Cloud Computing is an extension of SOA: Application-as-a service, Storage-as-a-service, Data-as-a-service.
content.html: Cloud Computing is an extension of SOA: Application-as-a service, Storage-as-a-service, Data-as-a-service.

content.text: For most people, Cloud Computing is about storing data on the web:
content.html: For most people, Cloud Computing is about storing data on the web:

content.text: The reasons are pretty obvious:
content.html: The reasons are pretty obvious:

content.text: With AppML, it is very easy to put both databases and applications in the cloud.
content.html: With AppML, it is very easy to put both databases and applications in the cloud.
